definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: An old women found out a empty bottle which had ever been filled the best wine .
sentences.chinese: 一个老太婆找到一个不久前曾装过最好陈酒的空酒瓶。

sentences.english: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.
sentences.chinese: 没有人喝了陈酒又想喝新的，他总说陈的好。

sentences.english: Old friends and old wine are best.
Ten years' wine -Wuliangye, mixed with Worm grass, made up Dadaohexie Wuliangye.
sentences.chinese: 大道和谐五粮液，十年陈酒虫草镶。

sentences.english: 39And no one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, 'The old is better.'
sentences.chinese: 没有人喝了陈酒又想喝新的，他总说陈的好。

sentences.english: It is left to posterity a jar of wine.
sentences.chinese: 青春是留给后人的一坛陈酒。

sentences.english: Russian Reform Old Wine in New Bottle.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯改革新瓶装陈酒。

definition: "yellow wine" (mulled rice wine, usually served warm)
name of a famous Tang dynasty wine/same as 白酒[bai2 jiu3]
to brew/to make (wine, vinegar, soybean paste etc) by fermentation
age of wine (i.e. how long it has been matured)
to ferment/to brew/to make honey (of bees)/to lead to/to form gradually/wine/stuffed vegetables (cooking method)
bejeweled nectar (idiom); ambrosia of the immortals/superb liquor/top quality wine
